title.narrative: LEGAL AND INSTITUTIONAL FRAMEWORK FOR CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Government institutions have increased capacity to strengthen the legal and policy framework for specialised protection of children in compliance with international standards, which contributes to Access To Justice, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those who are at risk, who are victims of violence, who are without parental care, and who are in contact and conflict with the law, benefit from a specialized legal, policy and institutional framework and have access to coordinated prevention and response services.

sector.narrative: Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government institutions have increased capacity to strengthen the legal and policy framework for specialised protection of children in compliance with international standards

description.narrative: UNICEF Chile focused its efforts on strengthening proposed legal framework and the capacity of new child rights institutions established to ensure coordination, implementation, and monitoring of public policies for promoting and protecting children's rights. UNICEF Chile contributed to strengthen and position the role of the Children's Ombudsperson's Office for effective monitoring, promotion, and protection of children's rights. UNICEF Chile strengthened the legislative monitoring and advocated with Congress members to comply with international standards with all draft bills that affect children's life. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: % of drafts laws related to child protection with UNICEFs proposals and recommendations integrated.

target.value: 2022:70% of draft laws related to child protection have incorporated UNICEF recommendations

title.narrative: # of public policies and institutional protocols in which UNICEFs proposals and recommendations to align with CRC have been integrated.

target.value: 2022:60% of public policies and institutional protocols have incorporated UNICEF
